ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Left Cholesteatoma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of chronic otalgia, otorrhea, and tympanic membrane perforation; audiogram shows conductive hearing loss; CT scan confirmed cholesteatoma.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds and determine the type and degree of hearing loss.
To assess speech detection thresholds (SAT) given the patient's language barrier.
To assess middle ear function and tympanic membrane compliance.
To assess the acoustic reflex pathway, though limited by middle ear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with a slight to moderately severe high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss in the right ear and a moderately severe to severe mixed/conductive hearing loss in the left ear. The left ear demonstrates significant air-bone gaps. Speech detection thresholds are consistent with pure-tone findings. Immittance testing reveals a hypercompliant system in the right ear, while testing was deferred in the left ear due to otorrhea. Findings are consistent with the medical diagnosis of left cholesteatoma.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Slight SNHL rising to normal (250-1000 Hz), sloping to moderate/moderately severe (6000-8000 Hz). Left ear: Moderately severe rising to mild conductive loss (250-3000 Hz), sloping to severe conductive loss (4000-8000 Hz) with significant air-bone gaps.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SAT: Right 10 dB HL, Left 40 dB HL. Consistent with PTA. WRS could not be measured due to language barrier.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Type Ad (hypercompliant), static admittance 3.0 mL. Left ear: Not tested due to otorrhea.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Not measured due to artifact from hypercompliant TM (Right) and otorrhea (Left).

proposed_items: Tympanoplasty and mastoidectomy (recommended by otologist but declined by patient)
Regular follow-up appointments (wait and watch approach)
counseling_actions: Discussed CT scan results confirming cholesteatoma
Counseled on the standard medical recommendation for surgery versus the risks of conservative management
Instructed to report any changes in symptoms immediately

escalation.rationale_short: Active cholesteatoma with otorrhea and otalgia requires medical management.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor cholesteatoma progression and hearing status (wait and watch).
